title: How to Make Spanish Lentils

steps.headline: Heat the olive oil in the saucepan.
Add the onion and cook for five minutes.
steps.description: Allow to soften but do not brown.

steps.headline: Add garlic and carrots and cook for another 2 minutes.
Pour in the wine and simmer for 2 minutes.
Pour in the vegetable stock and add the tomatoes, lentils and bay leaves.
Bring the mixture to a boil.
steps.description: Once boiling, turn the heat down, cover and allow to simmer gently for 45 minutes. Keep an eye on the cooking and if the lentils become dry earlier, add a little more stock to keep it cooking.

steps.headline: Add the herbs and stir in.
steps.description: Season with the paprika and salt and pepper to taste.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: It is best served in a table suitable dish that diners can help themselves from.

text: Heat the olive oil in the saucepan.  Add the onion and cook for five minutes. Allow to soften but do not brown. Add garlic and carrots and cook for another 2 minutes.  Pour in the wine and simmer for 2 minutes.  Pour in the vegetable stock and add the tomatoes, lentils and bay leaves.  Bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, turn the heat down, cover and allow to simmer gently for 45 minutes. Keep an eye on the cooking and if the lentils become dry earlier, add a little more stock to keep it cooking. Add the herbs and stir in. Season with the paprika and salt and pepper to taste. Serve. It is best served in a table suitable dish that diners can help themselves from. Finished.
